results.title: An Untitled film
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed black and white film in slow motion of life on a farm - dogs, cats, chickens, horses, a man shovelling and burning grass, and a boy watching a chicken being strangled. These strong images are accompanied by experimental music that compliments this well shot film.

results.title: An Unremarkable birth
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A growing number of parents are concerned about the impersonal approach to childbirth seen in many hospitals. They find hospital procedures inflexible and more often geared to the needs of the institution than to those of child and parent. Members of the medical profession and parents discuss today’s obstetric methods and alternatives to them. The film candidly records the birth of a baby and the interaction of mother and father.

results.title: An unnecessary famine
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Peter Gordon, Chris Bryer and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: Using Sudan as an example, shows that the causes of hunger in developing nations are both natural and political. Considers the roles of the World Bank and the major economic powers in this situation

results.title: An Unmarried woman
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Tony Ray and Fox
results.brief_description: Jill Clayburgh and Alan Bates star in this excellent production depicting the reconstruction of a life, as Clayburgh struggles to find herself after her husband leaves her for another woman. Torn between conflicting forces, her lovers and her daughter, Clayburgh learns to take control of her life. This film became a beacon for the Women’s Movement in the 1970’s.

results.title: An Unfinished piece for mechanical piano
results.brief_description: Platonov is thirty-five and believes he is a failure. Caught between ex-lovers at a wealthy widow’s estate, he recalls youthful ideas while facing present reality. This sparkling adaptation is based on Chekhov’s first play ‘Platonov’, and it reveals the essence of the writer’s tragi-comic world. An outstanding cast of leading Russian actors makes it the most idiomatic of all Chekhov films. Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: An Unexpected party
results.creator_credit: Michael Bond, Ivor Wood and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”
When word arrives that Paddington’s Aunt Lucy is celebrating her one-hundredth birthday, the Browns offer to send Paddington home to Lima to visit for the occasion. The Browns are afraid he will leave forever, but he assures them that he will return. Adapted from Chapter 7 from the book Paddington Marches On by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: An Oriental city: Canton China
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens, Louis De Rochemont and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: In ancient oriental cities where there is contact with other countries through trade, there is an incongruous mixture of modern ways with the old. Canton is an old city steeped in the traditions of many generations. Its location of the Si River makes it an important centre of commerce and industry.

results.title: An Ordinary woman
results.brief_description: Jackie is 38 years old. She lives with John and they have two small children. Once she wanted to be an opera singer. Once she had a boyfriend called Paul who married someone else. Once she travelled overseas. In the Sixties she was in love with Charlie. In the Seventies she sang in a band. In the Eighties she makes scones with the kids. In the process of (re) presenting an ordinary woman’s life this film explores questions of identity, representation and truth.
